metadata.name: Potential Dropper Script Execution Via WScript/CScript
metadata.comment: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wscript.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cscript.exe'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\tmp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\users\\public\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(':\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.js')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jse')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.vba')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.vbe')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.vbs')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.wsf'))))

output.summary: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

metadata.objective: False positive: Some installers might generate a similar behavior. An initial baseline is required References: https://thedfirreport.com/2023/10/30/netsupport-intrusion-results-in-domain-compromise/, https://redcanary.com/blog/gootloader/
